snippet: After what appeared to be a morning lull, Sunni fighters destroyed the Police Headquarters and mayor’s office as violence resumed.
abstract: Sunni militants of Al Qaeda destroy Falluja Police Headquarters and mayor's office, plant their flag atop other government buildings and decree the Iraqi city to be their new independent state; advances by Al-Qaeda-aligned Islamic State in Iraq and Syria are escalating threat to Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki.

byline.original: By YASIR GHAZI and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Yasir Ghazi reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Anbar Province.

lead_paragraph: After what appeared to be a morning lull, Sunni fighters destroyed the Police Headquarters and mayor’s office as violence resumed.

headline.main: Iraq Fighters, Qaeda Allies, Claim Falluja as New State
headline.print_headline: Iraq Fighters, Qaeda Allies, Claim Falluja As New State

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
